title.narrative: Community Based Building-Back-Better Reconstruction: Improving School And Children’S Resilience In Zambézia Province, Mozambique

description.narrative:
The ultimately purpose of the current agreement is to strengthen the resilience of schools to disasters, through building back better interventions, increasing the child and community safety to natural hazards and allowing the children back to safe learning environment. Following the Safer School Project´s recommendations and the Child Friendly and safer schools activities (UNICEF contribution 2014) both partnered with UN-Habitat, the initiatives have made increasingly important contributions in order to mainstream disaster risk reduction into the governmental construction programmes. The intervention has two specific aims
To strengthen the local capacities to respond, adapt, and mitigate the risk of disasters through the implementation of building-back-better school reconstruction including child-friendly sanitation facilities. This will be done through delivering on daily-basis technical assistance in the field, making available building material and piloting architectural typologies adapted to the specific natural hazards and local conditions.
2. To reinforce the awareness at high political level on school safety and disaster resistant public infrastructure in order to incorporate sustainable reconstruction into the sectors, mainly with the ministries, NGOs, UN agencies and donors community.
